job_title: Field Marketing Manager Data Analytics, EMEA
job_description:
Transforming the Future with the Convergence of Simulation and Data

Field Marketing Manager Data Analytics, EMEA

Job Summary

Function/Team:

Field Marketing Team

Location:

London, Paris or Munich a possibility

Contract Type:

Permanent

Reporting Line:

Director of Marketing, Data Analytics

Work Hours:

40 hours per week

Who We Are

Altair is leading the global convergence evolution toward smart, connected everything by delivering ground-breaking solutions in data analytics, simulation, high-performance computing, and smart connected products (IoT).

You will find a different culture at Altair in the way we work, how we interact and the collaborative approach we bring to projects. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own. Your ideas are heard, your efforts are visible and your work impacts company growth. Communication is open and teamwork is encouraged.

What You Will Do

Reporting to the Global Director of Marketing, Data Analytics the Field Marketing Manager DA, EMEA is responsible for the creation and execution of marketing strategies, campaigns and events for Altair’s data analytics business branch in EMEA.

As part of the Altair data analytics field marketing team, you will collaborate closely with all Altair marketing teams (field, IMC, solutions), sales enablement and the data analytics sales leadership. Qualified candidates must be strategic thinkers and creative, while being hands on in executing campaigns. They should have a good market understanding of the data analytics marketing in EMEA, be strong communicators and team spirited.

The importance of creating and managing global campaigns has increased dramatically as the focus of marketing is shifting towards engagement creation, contextual marketing and lifecycle marketing. At Altair we are building upon our global campaign approach to innovate and execute global campaigns through multichannel marketing.

This Field Marketing Manager DA, EMEA will have manage one additional team member and be responsible for designing and executing integrated, GDPR compliant marketing campaigns, driving awareness and lead generation activities that support the EMEA business plan. This includes developing a mix of promotional creative content and activities including online events, live-events, seminars, direct mail, email, advertising and others as need determines to drive lead generation and awareness for all global regions and reporting out on success of those activities.

Responsibilities:

· Accountable for campaign architecture, execution, delivery and measurement for EMEA region.

· Responsible for creating EMEA campaigns tied to business segment, personas and the customer journey lifecycle.

· Campaign plan design and execution tied to corporate goals/themes and measuring effectiveness & success of those programs; analytical skills required.

· Balance project scope and budget

· Develop bill of materials per campaign to include an integrated marketing mix of offline and online elements.

· Collaborating with other marketing team members and regional stakeholders to develop campaign assets on time,

· Working with the Sales organization to ensure appropriate and timely follow-up of marketing generated leads.

· Support channel partner/vendor relationships and Altair partner marketing teams to ensure seamless implementation of new marketing initiatives

· Plan and manage Partner Marketing programs in region

· Analyzing campaign effectiveness, delivering results to all stakeholders and management

· Coordination of regional event logistics and key strategic decisions with the regional marketing teams to ensure successful execution and ROI.

· Manage lead upload and measurement process, process, analyze results and create reporting for event campaigns. Utilize these reports to make approval recommendations for future events.

· Initiate recommendations to improve marketing and event processes and increasing overall efficiencies. Actively researches, learns and incorporates new means and methods whenever and wherever possible to improve processes.

· Confident in leading multiple projects.

What You Will Need

· Bachelor’s Degree required in Marketing, Communications, or a related discipline. Minimum of 3 years’ experience for a software or technology provider; Minimum of 5 years’ experience working with technology partners of various types and managing relationships.

· Knowledge of GDPR and creating campaigns that are GDPR compliant.

· Experience in software marketing.

· Experience in software marketing for data analytics is a plus.

· Proven track record of successfully creating customer campaign content.

· An understanding of powerful story-telling with a creative eye for design.

· Modern sales and marketing technology & tools understanding like the use of CRM systems, marketing automation systems, google analytics and techniques to create SEM, SEO, retargeting, banner, display advertisement and landing pages a plus. Ideally experienced with HubSpot, SalesForce etc.

· Exceptional communication skills: must be able to articulate a clear, persuasive argument and present data in an effective and actionable manner orally and in writing with both internal and external teams.

· Excellent collaboration, organizational and project management skills

· Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize tasks, deliver high-quality work, under extreme pressure at times, within a dynamic organization.

· Ability to effectively analyze and report out on campaign results and leverage data when developing new campaigns

Place of work

The future Field Marketing Manager DA, EMEA will be located in London, Paris or Munich.

Must have flexibility for travel up to 20% of the time.

How You Will Be Successful:

· Envision the Future

· Communicate Honestly and Broadly

· Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”

· Embrace Diversity and Take Risks

What We Offer:

· Competitive salary on offer (flexible dependent on experience of candidate).

· 25 days annual leave entitlement plus local bank holidays and 3 days Christmas shutdown (pro-rata based on full time hours).

· Flexible / hybrid working environment.

· Competitive benefits package post-probationary period including but not limited to:
• Comprehensive pension scheme with enhanced employer contribution – 10%.
• Monthly gym membership for self
• Health Insurance for self and family
• Optical/Dental Cashplan for self and spouse
• Life Insurance at 4x salary benefit
• Income protection and comprehensive sick pay cover/enhanced statutory schemes
• Regular team rewards including team building events/dinners/activities.

· Training and development opportunities

· Additional Charity Day for each employee

· Eligibility for our Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

Why Work with Us:

Altair is a global technology company that provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of data analytics, product development, and high-performance computing (HPC). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.

Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing.

For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com .

Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD
